newsitem.title: USA: U.S. OPTIONS FOCUS/Investor makes big downside bet.
newsitem.headline: U.S. OPTIONS FOCUS/Investor makes big downside bet.

text.p: An investor placed a big bet on a market correction by June with a put bear spread in S&P 500 stock index options on Thursday.
The SPX June 725 put and the June 775 put each traded 14,770 contracts. The 725s went out mostly at 10-5/8 and the 775s went out mostly at 22.

"They did a June 775-725 put bear spread for 10 points," said Michael Schwartz, managing director at Oppenheimer & Co. "The profit potential if the market is at 725 or lower (at expiration) is 40 points."
The profit would be the difference between the 50-point spread of the options and the net cost to do the trade.
"It looks like a big speculation on a correction or just a hedge fund hedging a large portfolio," Schwartz said.
He said the trade, done throughout the day in small blocks, was likely driven by an institutional investor because SPX options are geared toward insitutions, with European-style expirations.
Options with European-style expirations can only be exercised on the expiration day. American-style options can be exercised at any time up to the expiration.
In afternoon trading, the underlying SPX was up 1.49 poitns at 787.72, off its session high of 794.67, which was a record intraday peak.
The index had reached five-straight record closing highs through Wednesday, when it finished at 786.23, shrugging off a drubbing in blue chip International Business Machines Corp
The SPX June 725 put had open interest of 36,278 through Wednesday and the 775 put had open interest of 4,450.
Most other SPX options were not particularly active, with few trading more than 3,000 contracts.
In the S&P 100 index .OEX, put options continued to be the option of choice, with put volume outpacing call volume by 55,501 to 41,846.
The OEX was up 2.37 at 773.55 after hitting an all-time intraday high at 779.85.
The heaviest OEX volume was in the February 790 call, which traded nearly 5,200 contracts, and the February 775 put, which traded about 5,040.
Other actives included the February 700 put, the February 760 put, the Febraury 775 call adn the February 780 call. ((--G. Crawford, 312 408 8750/Email: derivatives@reuters.com))
